current_medications.description: List all medications you are currently taking

medications.name: Elexacaftor/Tezacaftor/Ivacaftor (Trikafta)
medications.purpose: CFTR modulator therapy - cornerstone of CF treatment

medications.name: Dornase alfa (Pulmozyme)
medications.purpose: Break down DNA in mucus to thin secretions

medications.name: Pancrelipase (Creon)
medications.frequency: With all meals and snacks (5-6 times daily)

medications.name: Omeprazole
medications.purpose: Reduce stomach acid for better enzyme function

allergies.description: List any known allergies (medications, food, environmental)

current_symptoms.description: Describe any symptoms you are currently experiencing

respiratory_symptoms.shortness_of_breath: Mild dyspnea, significantly improved since starting Trikafta 2 years ago. Can walk over a mile without stopping.
respiratory_symptoms.coughing: Productive cough throughout day, less severe than before Trikafta. Performs airway clearance 3x daily for 30 minutes each.
respiratory_symptoms.sputum_production: Moderate amounts, 2-3 tablespoons daily. Usually clear to white, tracks color changes.

general_symptoms.fatigue: Mild fatigue, much improved on Trikafta. Can work full time.
general_symptoms.weight_changes: Gained 12 lbs since starting Trikafta, now at healthy weight
general_symptoms.sleep_quality: Good - sleeps 7-8 hours, rarely woken by cough

digestive_symptoms.abdominal_pain: Occasional cramping if forgets enzymes with meals
digestive_symptoms.bowel_movements: Regular, 1-2 times daily. Occasionally loose if enzyme dose is off.
digestive_symptoms.bloating: Occasional if high-fat meal without adequate enzymes

pain_assessment.description: Rate your pain levels and describe location

chest_pain.frequency: Occasional, during airway clearance or coughing

other_pain.description: Occasional discomfort, possibly related to liver (monitoring for Trikafta side effect)

functional_status.description: Rate your ability to perform daily activities
functional_status.walking_distance: Can walk over a mile comfortably, exercises regularly
functional_status.stair_climbing: Can climb multiple flights without difficulty
functional_status.work_status: Working full-time as digital marketing coordinator, excellent attendance
functional_status.exercise_tolerance: Exercises 5 times per week - combination of cardio and strength training. Runs 2-3 miles at a time.

quality_of_life.description: Rate how your condition affects your daily life
quality_of_life.physical_limitations: Minimal limitations since Trikafta. Can participate in most activities. Treatment time (3 hours daily) is main constraint.
quality_of_life.emotional_wellbeing: Very good. Trikafta has been life-changing. Occasional anxiety about long-term prognosis. Active in CF community.
quality_of_life.social_activities: Very active socially, careful during cold/flu season. Advocates for CF awareness.
quality_of_life.sleep_quality: Excellent - much improved since starting Trikafta

environmental_exposures.description: Note any environmental factors affecting your health
environmental_exposures.occupational_exposures: Office environment, works hybrid schedule. No significant exposures.
environmental_exposures.home_environment: Apartment living, maintains clean environment. Avoids hot tubs, jacuzzis. HEPA filters throughout home. Regular bathroom cleaning to prevent mold/bacteria.
environmental_exposures.air_quality_concerns: Monitors air quality, stays indoors on poor air days
environmental_exposures.recent_travel: Traveled to Colorado for skiing 1 month ago with portable equipment

compliance.description: How well are you following your treatment plan
compliance.medication_adherence: 98% compliant - extremely dedicated to treatment regimen. Uses smartphone reminders and tracking app.
compliance.pulmonary_rehabilitation: Not currently enrolled, maintains independent exercise program
compliance.dietary_restrictions: High-calorie, high-fat diet (2500-3000 calories daily). Takes enzymes with all meals. Generous salt intake.

recent_hospitalizations.treatment: IV tobramycin and cefepime, aggressive airway clearance

recent_procedures.result: FEV1 78% predicted - best ever! Up from 45% pre-Trikafta
Stable bronchiectasis, improved aeration compared to prior
Normal glucose tolerance, no evidence of CFRD currently
Mildly elevated ALT (55), stable, within acceptable range on Trikafta
Pseudomonas aeruginosa (chronic), mucoid. Staphylococcus aureus. Sensitive to usual antibiotics.
Mild osteopenia, improved from prior. Continue calcium and vitamin D.

upcoming_appointments.purpose: Routine monitoring - PFTs, cultures, weight check, medication review
Annual diabetes screening and bone health follow-up
Dietary review and weight maintenance strategies

additional_notes.patient_concerns: Grateful for Trikafta's impact but concerned about long-term side effects, especially liver function. Interested in family planning - wants to discuss pregnancy with CF. Occasional anxiety about antibiotic resistance with chronic Pseudomonas. Wondering if she should consider eradication therapy. Also concerned about CFRD risk as she ages.
additional_notes.goals_for_visit: Maintain current excellent health status, discuss family planning, review infection control strategies, optimize nutrition
questions_for_doctor: How are my liver enzymes looking on Trikafta long-term?
Should we try to eradicate my chronic Pseudomonas?
What do I need to know about pregnancy planning with CF?
Should I see a high-risk OB specialist before conceiving?
Are there any new developments in CF treatment I should know about?
How often should I have diabetes screening?
Should I increase my bone health supplements?
Are there any clinical trials I might be eligible for?
What's the latest research on CF life expectancy with modulators?
